x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Nonprofit organizations often struggle with managing award nominations and selection processes efficiently. Submissions are typically collected through emails or spreadsheets, leading to data inconsistency, lost information, and manual scoring errors. Evaluations lack transparency—judges work in silos, scoring criteria differ, and there’s little visibility into progress or fairness. Administrators spend excessive time coordinating nominations, tracking eligibility, and consolidating results. Without a unified platform, the entire process—from nomination to final selection—becomes time-consuming, error-prone, and difficult to audit. There’s a clear need for a digital, transparent, and automated solution that streamlines award management while ensuring equitable recognition of deserving candidates.

How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

ServiceNow Products & Capabilities Used

Service Catalog / Record Producers: Nomination and judging forms.

Flow Designer + Subflows: Automation of routing, scoring, and notifications.

IntegrationHub: Connect external directories or collaboration tools (like SharePoint or Slack).

Performance Analytics (PA): Visual dashboards for trends, fairness, and outcome transparency.

Now Mobile / Employee Center: Easy submission and evaluation experience.

Document Management: Secure storage of supporting materials and audit history.

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

Employee Center / Service Portal (UI Builder) — nomination + judging workspaces

Service Catalog / Record Producers — nomination & evaluation forms

Flow Designer + Subflows — routing, validation, weighted scoring, notifications

IntegrationHub (REST/Webhooks) — CRM/Directory lookups, file/signature tools, Slack/Teams

Performance Analytics (PA) — KPIs (submissions, review progress, variance, time-to-decision)

Now Mobile — judge tasks, scoring on the go, push reminders

Knowledge Management — criteria rubrics, FAQs, policies

Document Management / Attachments — evidence files, audit trail

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

. Data Integration and Consistency

Collecting nomination data from multiple sources (forms, emails, external databases) can cause data duplication or inconsistency.

Integration with third-party systems (e.g., nonprofit directories, e-signature tools) requires secure and well-managed APIs.

🔒 2. Fairness and Evaluation Transparency

Designing scoring models that ensure unbiased and consistent evaluation across categories can be complex.

Managing access so judges only see relevant entries while maintaining confidentiality needs careful RBAC (role-based access control) setup.

🧠 3. User Adoption and Training

Judges, staff, and volunteers may have varying levels of technical comfort, requiring simple UI/UX and training sessions.

Encouraging adoption from traditional, email-based processes to a digital system might face initial resistance.

⚙️ 4. Workflow Customization

Each nonprofit may have unique award categories, criteria, and review rounds, making the workflow highly configurable.Balancing flexibility with ease of administration will be key.
